Title: Cylindrical Box (Pyxis)
Dimensions: H with knob: 5 1/2 x 5 1/8 in. (14 x 13.05 cm)
Description: This ivory box is decorated with roundels and drinking figures and bears an inscription in "naskhi."
Provenance: Baer Collection, Frankfurt, Nuremberg, Germanisches Museum; J. G. Pollack Collection, London [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Henri Daguerre, Paris [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Henry Walters, Baltimore, 1925, by purchase; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Venetian (Italian)
DisplayLocation: Centre Street: Third Floor: Islamic Art
